moduleTitle: ASEAN Economic Community Law and Policy
preclusion: Students who are taking or have taken LL5202.
prerequisite: NUS Compulsory Core Curriculum or its equivalent..
moduleDescription: ASEAN leaders agreed to create a single market – the ASEAN Economic Community – by 2015. Due to sovereignty concerns, ASEAN leaders did not create a single supranational authority to regulate this market. This course examines how ASEAN member states and institutions are filling in the vacuum through formal and informal means. Students will understand how regional policymaking affects domestic laws and policies within ASEAN.
